name: Cretan Brake Fern
description: Pteris cretica, commonly known as Cretan Brake Fern or Ribbon Fern, is an elegant fern native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It features arching fronds with long, narrow pinnae (leaflets) that create a graceful, ribbon-like appearance. The fronds can be solid green or variegated with white or cream stripes down the center. The plant displays an upright to arching growth habit and typically reaches 30-60 cm in height. It's a popular houseplant and terrarium fern due to its elegant appearance and relatively easy care requirements. The fern thrives in high humidity and filtered light, making it ideal for closed terrarium environments.
careTips: Provide bright, indirect light - avoid direct sun
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Can tolerate lower light but grows best in bright indirect light
Fertilize monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer
Mist regularly or provide high humidity
